Sentencas: Typical solar power tower (SPT) systems employ molten salt as the heat transfer and thermal energy storage medium to facilitate stable energy output.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells

Sentencas: However, these systems are constrained by their limited operating temperature, which is insufficient to supply heat for high-temperature electrolysis.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells

Sentencas: In this paper, a small-scale (2.5 MW) solar-thermal-assisted energy system with a SPT, a supercritical CO 2 (SCO 2 ) Brayton cycle, and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells (SOEC/SOFC) is proposed.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells

Sentencas: With heat supply via air, the SOEC subsystem can operate at 800 degrees C to reach high energy efficiency and reduce electric demand, which replaces conventional waste heat from flue gas produced by fossil fuel combustion.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells

Sentencas: Such a system can convert excess electricity into hydrogen for storage or sale and provides stable electricity 24 h a day.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells

Sentencas: The key factors determining the system performance are investigated, including the turbine inlet parameters, main compressor inlet parameters, the recompression fraction of the SCO 2 subsystem, and the operating temperature and current density of the SOEC/SOFC subsystems.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells

Sentencas: The case study shows that the net hydrogen output can reach 13365.4 kWh/d in summer with the SOEC operating at 800 degrees C, which is 86.7 % higher compared to 7157.6 kWh/d when operating at 600 degrees C. To recoup the investment costs by the 20th year, hydrogen must be priced at 6.5 $/kg.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells

Sentencas: After multi-objective optimization, the optimal exergy efficiency and capital investment for the SPT-SCO 2 -SOEC subsystem are determined to be 29.6 % and 3.65 M$, respectively.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells

Sentencas: For the SOFC subsystem, the corresponding figures are 56.1 % for exergy efficiency and 0.23 M$ for capital investment.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells

Sentencas: This study benefits the solar power generation and hydrogen production by high-temperature electrolysis.
Titulo: Performance evaluation and multi-objective optimization of a solar-thermal-assisted energy system: Supercritical CO 2 Brayton cycle and solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells
